meanings.definition: A piece of armor, typically made of chain mail, covering the body from the neck to the waist.
meanings.sent1: The knight wore a hauberk for protection in battle.
meanings.sent2: The hauberk gleamed in the sunlight as the warrior prepared for combat.
meanings.sent3: It was quite a sight to see a squirrel wearing a tiny hauberk made of acorn shells.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was like a hauberk, shielding her from the harsh words around her.
meanings.sent5: The ancient hauberk displayed in the museum was a testament to the craftsmanship of the past.

meanings.definition: To cover or protect with a hauberk.
meanings.sent1: The blacksmith would hauberk the knight before every battle.
meanings.sent2: She decided to hauberk her heart against further disappointment.
meanings.sent3: The chef would hauberk the pie with a golden crust, making it irresistible.
meanings.sent4: His words hauberked her soul, shielding her from the pain of loss.
meanings.sent5: The love of his family hauberked him against the challenges of life.
